course_description: Introduces the basic structure, pricing, and management of financial risks by private health insurance plans, and the estimation of future expenditures for public health insurance programs. Examines the operation of health insurance plans from both the buyer and the insurer perspectives; how health plans employ actuarial estimates to project the cost of their benefit packages and determine the premiums they charge; and methodology as it pertains to the projection of costs in public health insurance programs.
instructors: Curtis S Florence II - Primary Instructor
schedule_location: Th 4pm-6:50pm in R. Randall Rollins Bldg. R201
